Title.evidence: This study investigated the effect of preoperative home-based exercise training (PHET) on QoL after LC surgery.

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients awaiting LC resection were randomized to PHET or a control group (CG).

Intervention.evidence: The PHET program combined aerobic and resistance exercise, with weekly telephone supervision.

Objective.evidence: This study investigated the effect of preoperative home-based exercise training (PHET) on QoL after LC surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcome was QoL-assessed with the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire C30 (QLQ-C30) at baseline, before surgery, and 1 month after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients awaiting LC resection were randomized to PHET or a control group (CG).

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study included 41 patients (68.1 ± 9.3 years; 68.3% male) in the intention-to-treat analysis (20 PHET patients, 21 CG patients).

Number_Analysed.evidence: The study included 41 patients (68.1 ± 9.3 years; 68.3% male) in the intention-to-treat analysis (20 PHET patients, 21 CG patients).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Between-group differences in global QoL were statistically and clinically significant before surgery (mean difference [MD], 13.5 points; 95% confidence interval [CI], 2.4–24.6; p = 0.019) and after surgery (MD, 12.4 points; 95% CI, 1.3–23.4; p = 0.029), favoring PHET.
